column2: detailed analysis of tourist arrivals by airline carriers shows that Sri Lankan Airlines

column1: carried the largest share, contributing 24.8% of total arrivals. Following closely, Qatar
responsible for 7.55%, and Fly Dubai brought in 3.86% of the total tourist inflow to Sri
Lanka. This distribution indicates that while Sri Lankan Airlines plays a pivotal role in
inbound tourism, several other key international carriers, particularly from the Middle
East and South Asia, significantly support the country's tourism sector by connecting
diverse international markets to Sri Lanka.
